## Useful Info

**Orange crystal statues** are stationary guardians that have the ability to drain your [intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence"), your [MP](/MP "MP"), or to confuse you and your allies. Additionally they cast [Shadow Creatures](/Shadow_Creatures "Shadow Creatures"), flooding the area around them with powerful summoned monsters. If an orange crystal statue is in your [LOS](/LOS "LOS") and your [intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") is less than 4, you are at risk of [stat zero](/Stat_zero "Stat zero"). They can be found in various [vaults](/Vault "Vault") almost anywhere after the early [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon").

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                          |                                                      |
| :---------- | -------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Brain Feed](/Brain_Feed "Brain Feed")                   | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Draining Gaze](/Draining_Gaze "Draining Gaze")          | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot3       | [Mass Confusion](/Mass_Confusion "Mass Confusion")       | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot4       | [Shadow Creatures](/Shadow_Creatures "Shadow Creatures") | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- In general, try not to fight them while other hostile creatures are around.
- Although they're largely resistant to elemental magic, powerful [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic") spells can take them out quickly. [Shatter](/Shatter "Shatter") and [Lee's Rapid Deconstruction](/Lee%27s_Rapid_Deconstruction "Lee's Rapid Deconstruction") are particularly effective.

### Variant Orange Crystal Statues

[![Wucad mu statue.png](/images/4/41/Wucad_mu_statue.png)](/File:Wucad_mu_statue.png) A **Statue of Wucad Mu** guards the inner treasure chambers of [Wucad Mu's Monastery](/Wucad_Mu%27s_Monastery "Wucad Mu's Monastery"). Destroying it has the added bonus of wiping out any shadowy monks that are still running around.

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | This statue, made from a fine glassy orange crystal, depicts a mystic known as Wucad Mu, who mastered the matters of the mind. Beware of the statue's powers, as you have no chance in mental combat against it. |

[![Zot statue.png](/images/b/be/Zot_statue.png)](/File:Zot_statue.png) A **Lunar statue** guards a single acquirement-level item on [Lehudib's Moon Base](/Lehudib%27s_Moon_Base "Lehudib's Moon Base"). This variant has [Lehudib's Crystal Spear](/Lehudib%27s_Crystal_Spear "Lehudib's Crystal Spear") in addition to the spells above and a 20% higher cast rate.

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | An utterly bizarre statue, hewn from a single piece of dark gabbro scintillating with tiny crystals. It is impossible to tell whether the statue is intended to represent some creature or personage, or is completely abstract.One thing is certain: it is profoundly disturbing. |

## History

- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), orange crystal statues did not have [See Invisible](/See_Invisible "See Invisible").
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), they were speed 6 and did not have the Shadow Creatures or Abjuration spells.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), orange crystal statues inflicted the intelligence loss, MP drain, and confusion through irresistible [Divinations](/Divinations "Divinations") [miscast effects](/Miscast_effect "Miscast effect"). They could also be immediately destroyed with a zap from a [wand of disintegration](/Wand_of_disintegration "Wand of disintegration").
- Orange crystal statues used to also make you forget spells and maps.

An intricately carved idol of some nameless godling, hewn of translucent orange crystal. Its lifeless eyes seem to glitter uncannily with a wicked intelligence. It is capable of unleashing a powerful psychic assault upon the minds of any who approach it.

Useful Info

Orange crystal statues are stationary guardians that have the ability to drain your intelligence, your MP, or to confuse you and your allies. Additionally they cast Shadow Creatures, flooding the area around them with powerful summoned monsters. If an orange crystal statue is in your LOS and your intelligence is less than 4, you are at risk of stat zero. They can be found in various vaults almost anywhere after the early Dungeon.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Brain Feed Magical flag
Slot2 Draining Gaze Magical flag
Slot3 Mass Confusion Magical flag
Slot4 Shadow Creatures Magical flag

Tips & Tricks

  • In general, try not to fight them while other hostile creatures are around.
  • Although they're largely resistant to elemental magic, powerful Earth Magic spells can take them out quickly. Shatter and Lee's Rapid Deconstruction are particularly effective.

Variant Orange Crystal Statues

A Statue of Wucad Mu guards the inner treasure chambers of Wucad Mu's Monastery. Destroying it has the added bonus of wiping out any shadowy monks that are still running around.

This statue, made from a fine glassy orange crystal, depicts a mystic known as Wucad Mu, who mastered the matters of the mind. Beware of the statue's powers, as you have no chance in mental combat against it.

A Lunar statue guards a single acquirement-level item on Lehudib's Moon Base. This variant has Lehudib's Crystal Spear in addition to the spells above and a 20% higher cast rate.

An utterly bizarre statue, hewn from a single piece of dark gabbro scintillating with tiny crystals. It is impossible to tell whether the statue is intended to represent some creature or personage, or is completely abstract.

One thing is certain: it is profoundly disturbing.

History

  • Prior to 0.19, orange crystal statues did not have See Invisible.
  • Prior to 0.17, they were speed 6 and did not have the Shadow Creatures or Abjuration spells.
  • Prior to 0.15, orange crystal statues inflicted the intelligence loss, MP drain, and confusion through irresistible Divinations miscast effects. They could also be immediately destroyed with a zap from a wand of disintegration.
  • Orange crystal statues used to also make you forget spells and maps.
